intro: Seseli divaricatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are usually narrow and divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Seseli divaricatum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
